meanings.definition: The action of ending a connection or relationship.
meanings.sent1: After the company downsized, many employees received severance pay.
meanings.sent2: The severance between the two friends was mutual and amicable.
meanings.sent3: The severance of the partnership left both parties free to pursue new opportunities.
meanings.sent4: The severance of the old tree branches allowed new growth to flourish.
meanings.sent5: The severance of the internet connection caused frustration for the entire household.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or separating something.
meanings.sent1: The severance of the rope was clean and precise.
meanings.sent2: The severance of the cake into equal slices made it easy to share.
meanings.sent3: The severance of the paper with scissors was a fun craft activity.
meanings.sent4: The severance of ties with toxic people is important for mental health.
meanings.sent5: The severance of the fabric created two separate pieces for sewing.
